intro: Plesioneuron belense, commonly known as the Belenese fern, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its reproductive structures include spore-bearing soruses located on the underside of its leaves. The botanical features of Plesioneuron belense make it an interesting subject for study in botany and conservation.
